body: I would also love to have it back :)

I found this commit: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/commit/9d4e526e1b1ffaaac5072583ceb4cefa41a1ef55#diff-fa151380130110b5b1f7ba277afb356a

It removes the compact view, and is supposed to add a "Load more" button in the UI (I can't find this button). I reverted it in our fork, and it works, the compact view is back but there is no longer the 100 runs display limit.
Thanks @t-henri, so probably @Zangr knows what's up?

The other view was removed to allow us to have one consistent run-listing experience with the ability to list a param/metrics as a separate column on demand. If you want to display a metric/param on a separate column, you can click on that metric/param and select `Display as a separate column`.  If there are other use cases that make you want the removed view back please feel free to post here as well.
![display-collapse-column](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6811562/61964392-9744f980-af82-11e9-89d0-3bab32f2d625.gif)
The "Load more" button will only show when you have more runs to load. Currently, the load-size is set to 100, which means if you have less than 100 runs, you won't see the "Load more" button.

Well, yes, so the button was just doing and undoing the "Display as a separate column" function for all metrics and params at once, which is reasonable to have and becomes necessary, the more parameters your runs have. I think the use case is just to get an overview over more runs faster.

For me removing the button seems a step back. I can collect over 20 metrics for each run, which makes runs vertically looong.

Comparing 5 runs was quick before (had to scroll horizontally to the correct metric, but then all the runs were at reach.

As an additional comment (separate bug?), I find current release doesn't "remember" well all the filter params and columns, which makes me have to re-enter filtering conditions every single time I reload webpage; making current version a step back from 1.0 to me, at least from the tracking UI point of view.
@Zangr about the "Load More" button, I have 201 runs and I don't see it in the UI.
@t-henri, the "Load more" button will show when you scroll to the bottom of the table.
I really miss the tabular button. It made comparing runs so easy. Now its not.

Another issue that I see is that once the metric has been moved into its own column the heading only displays the first 18 characters and cannot be resized and the full name doesn't show up by hovering with the mouse.
Do you plan to bring back this view/feature? The suggested workaround doesn't work at all for my workflow.

@geniki, I plan to work on some refactoring on the runs table with @gioa during the last two weeks of this month. You are welcome to provide more details about your workflow and view preference so I can take those into consideration during the refactor.

Thanks, looking forward to that. 

We often have dozens of runs with dozens of params and as others above pointed out above, it's difficult to compare when you can see only, say, two runs at the same time.

Spreadsheet-like view is fairly established as useful I think.
@Zangr any new thoughts on this issue?
